Package dev.project276.main

Class GameInfo

java.lang.Object
dev.project276.main.GameInfo
Direct Known Subclasses:
JailCells, MazeThing, StarterLevel, StarterLevel2
public class GameInfo
extends java.lang.Object
Utility class that holds vital info about the game, such as the game board and the entity list, with utility functions to access/modify them. Essentially, represents each level of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameInfo

      public GameInfo()
      Default constructor. Game board is a maze with rows 15, cols = 20, walls all around it.

    • GameInfo

      public GameInfo​(Entity[][] gb)
      Constructor that takes in a user-defined game board.
      Parameters:
      gb - Entity[][] that represents the gameboard.

    • GameInfo

      public GameInfo​(Entity[][] gb, java.util.ArrayList<Entity> entityArrayList)
      Constructor that takes in a user-defined game board and an list of pre-defined entities
      Parameters:
      gb - Entity[][] that represents the gameboard.
      entityArrayList - ArrayList that contains the (non-floor/non-wall) entities.

    • GameInfo

      public GameInfo​(int nRows, int nCols)
      Constructor that takes in rows and cols and generates a random maze of size [rows][cols].
      Parameters:
      nRows - Rows of the maze.
      nCols - Columns of the maze.

    • GameInfo

      public GameInfo​(int nRows, int nCols, java.util.ArrayList<Entity> entityArrayList)
      Constructor that takes in rows, cols, and a list of pre-defined entities. Generates a random maze of size [rows][cols].
      Parameters:
      nRows - Rows of the maze.
      nCols - Columns of the maze.
      entityArrayList - ArrayList that contains the (non-floor/non-wall) entities.

    • checkBoardBounds

      public boolean checkBoardBounds​(int x, int y)
      Checks if the coordinates are valid (ie, won't cause an index error).
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to check.
      y - The y-coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are valid. false otherwise.

    • getEntityAt

      public Entity getEntityAt​(int x, int y)
      Gets the given wall/floor at (x, y).
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity.
      Returns:
      If the coordinates are valid, the entity at that point. Otherwise, returns null.

    • getListEntityAt

      public Entity getListEntityAt​(int x, int y)
      Gets the entity in the Entity list at (x, y), returns null if there isn't one. Returns the first occurrence of an entity.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity.
      Returns:
      If the coordinates are valid and there is an entity in the list with coordinates of (x, y), then the entity at that point. Otherwise, returns null.

    • getAllListEntitiesAt

      public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getAllListEntitiesAt​(int x, int y)
      Gets all the entities in the Entity list with coords (x, y). Returns an empty ArrayList if there isn't any.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity(ies).
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity(ies).
      Returns:
      If the coordinates are valid and there is an entity in the list with coordinates of (x, y), then the entities at that point. Otherwise, returns an empty ArrayList.

    • setWallAt

      public void setWallAt​(int x, int y)
      Sets a point on the gameBoard to a Wall.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the new wall.
      y - The y-coordinate of the new wall.

    • setFloorAt

      public void setFloorAt​(int x, int y)
      Sets a point on the gameBoard to a Floor.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the new floor.
      y - The y-coordinate of the new floor.

    • setManyWallsAlong

      public void setManyWallsAlong​(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Adds walls along the line between (startX,startY) and (endX,endY) to the Gameboard.

    • setManyWallsAt

      public void setManyWallsAt​(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> points)
      Adds all walls indicated by their points in the ArrayList to the Gameboard.
      Parameters:
      points - The List of points to set to walls.

    • expandGameBoard

      public void expandGameBoard()
      Expands the game board in accordance to MazeGenerator.expandGameBoard. Also multiplies rows and cols by 2.

    • findClosestReachablePoint

      public java.awt.Point findClosestReachablePoint​(java.awt.Point source)
      Searches like this (x = targets to compare to, o = already compared, t = target) Search Depth 1: Search Depth 2: x x x t x x o x x x o t o x x o x x
      Parameters:
      source - The Point to find the closest reachable point from.
      Returns:
      The closest reachable point.

    • isPointReachable

      public boolean isPointReachable​(int x, int y)
      Method that determines if a point on the board is reachable. A point is reachable if it is a floor on the gameBoard, and no Enemies or Players are on it.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate of the point to check.
      y - The y coordinate of the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the above conditions are met. false otherwise.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the Player from the Entity List.
      Returns:
      The Player if there is one. Returns null if there isn't.

    • getLineBetweenTwoPoints

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getLineBetweenTwoPoints​(java.awt.Point p1, java.awt.Point p2)
      Utility method that computes the best-fit line between two Points. The line is represented by an ArrayList of Points.
      Parameters:
      p1 - The first endpoint of the line.
      p2 - The second endpoint of the line.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Points representing the line, includes both endpoints.
